bibl.title: Women in Late Antique Egypt.
bibl.note: Introduction. - 1. Defining the period. - 2. The sources. - 3. The socio-economic spectrum: Women of means and slaves. - 4. Monastic women. - 5. The litigants: Pity the widow and orphan. - 6. Conclusion: Women in situ.

bibl.title: A Companion to Women in the Ancient World

bibl.seg: Moss Jennifer Sheridan, Women in Late Antique Egypt.
Sharon L. James and Sheila Dillon (Edd.), A Companion to Women in the Ancient World = Blackwell Companions to the Ancient World (Malden, MA - Oxford, 2012) pp. 502-512.

Introduction. - 1. Defining the period. - 2. The sources. - 3. The socio-economic spectrum: Women of means and slaves. - 4. Monastic women. - 5. The litigants: Pity the widow and orphan. - 6. Conclusion: Women in situ.
